body: Can you stick a `print(url)` in `/home/tony/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/kernel/connect.py` just above line 529, and see what it's trying to connect to?

I am wondering if some upgrades I had done recently could have caused this problem.  I had set up a ec2 instance with the same set-up (without the recent random ipython library upgrades) and it is still working fine.. Is there some way i can just do a fresh reinstall of everything?

Is there anything in your config files? Try making a blank profile `ipython profile create foo` and running the notebook with it `ipython notebook --profile foo`.

@minrk , I followed this back a bit, and it looks like it's ending up in `IPython.utils.localinterfaces` - do you have an idea how it could go wrong?

`ipython profile create foo` also throws an exception:

tony@tony-M51AC:~$ ipython notebook --profile foo

What do you get from `type ipython`? It doesn't make sense that `ipython profile create` would start the notebook.

typeing `type ipython` output:

ipython is hashed (/home/tony/anaconda/bin/ipython)

I just tried ipython profile create foo32 and it jenerated the default config files.

I believe I re-installed my conda distribution and the problem went away.
